column4: Hello. I've installed Ubuntu 9.10 and can't connect to my wlan. The SSID is showing in the network manager tool (so I assume the device is recognised), I entered the passphrase but I always get a "can't connect/no IP address" error message. Any idea where to look first?
type ifconfig at the shell prompt
Do you know how to do that?
There's (besides eth0 and lo) a wlan0 and a wmaster0 device.
How many ethernet NICs do you have?
Just eth0
How many wired and how many wireless?
How many physical wired and wireless connections?
eth0 is wired. There's only one wireless device 083a:4521 Accton Technology Corp
can you connect through the wired interface?
Yes
DHCP is working fine
Can you pastebin ifconfig?
http://pastebin.org/137825
Could you also pastebin ifconfig -a?
The same, no inactive devices here
Is your router using Wep, WPA, or WPA2, or unencrypted?
WPA2
Have you entered the password?
Yes.
I c&p'ed it directly from the router's coniguration interface
what does arp -n give you?
The arp table for eth0
What is the difference between "WPA1/2 passphrase" and "WPA1/2 PSK" in the network manager dialog?
